judgment_text:
Ladda 
IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY
ORDINARY ORIGINAL CIVIL JURISDICTION
 SUIT No. 524 OF 1964
Y.S. Nanjiah Setty & Ors
..Plaintiffs.
Vs
Jagdishprasad Poddar & Anr
..Defendants.
Mr. Shreeprakash Shivram Poddar, Defendant No.2 is present in-
person. 

CORAM : B.P. COLABAWALLA, J.

DATED :- 11th March, 2020.
P.C. :-
.
Today this matter has been placed on board for
directions because it has been brought to my attention by the
Registry that though by virtue of amendment granted by order
dated 23rd August, 1971 the heirs of defendant No.1 were brought on
record, inadvertently the name of Defendant No.2 was deleted when
the amendment was carried out. Defendant No.2 Mr. Shreeprakash
Poddar is in fact alive and present before me today. He has also
produced his Original Aadhar card as well as PAN card. The copies
of the aforesaid documents have also been tendered to the Court and
taken on record and marked  X  and  X-1  respectively. Clearly it
appears that defendant No.2 s name has been deleted by mistake. In
/2
-s-524-64.doc
fact, the name of Defendant No.1 Jagdishprasad Poddar ought to
have been deleted as he expired on 30th November, 1970 as
evidenced by the death certifcate produced by Defendant No.2
today. The copy of the said death Certifcate is also taken on record
and marked  X-2  for identifcation. In these circumstances, the
Registry is directed to delete the name of Defendant No.1 and
restore the name of Defendant No.2 in the papers and proceedings of
the above Suit and reconstruct the drawn up decree accordingly.
After the aforesaid process is done, the Registry shall issue a
certifed copy of the drawn up decree to Defendant No.2.
(B.P. COLABAWALLA, J.) 
/2
-s-524-64.doc
